Key Match Events: Adam Zampa took 4 wickets for 47 runs
Mitchell Starc took 2 wickets for 43 runs
Dilshan Madushanka took 3 wickets for 38 runs
Josh Inglis scored 58 runs off 59 balls
Mitchell Marsh scored 52 runs off 51 balls
Australia won by 5 wickets with 88 balls remaining
Post-Match Reflections: Adam Zampa: 'Cummins spell was a game-changer for us' and 'I didn't feel at my best but want to try and keep my wicket-taking attitude'
Kusal Mendis: 'If we scored 290-300, it would have been good on this pitch' and 'I hope Dasun and Matheesha recover quickly'
James Pattinson: 'We have a big game against Pakistan in Bangalore; that's going to be a tough one'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka suffered a batting collapse after racing to 125 for no loss
Australia's bowlers, particularly Adam Zampa, Mitchell Starc, and Dilshan Madushanka, performed well
Josh Inglis and Mitchell Marsh were key contributors with the bat
Sri Lanka's middle order struggled after the opening partnership
Adam Zampa was named Player of the Match
Others: Sri Lanka's bowling performance was strong with 3 wickets for 38 runs by Dilshan Madushanka
Australia's chase was completed with 88 balls remaining
The match was played at Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow
Chris Gaffaney and Joel Wilson were the match officials
Chris Brown was the TV umpire and Richie Richardson was the match referee
